Poundland completes UK-wide rollout of £1, £2, £3 pricing
26th September 2025
Yasmeen Louis
Discount Retail
Poundland has returned to a simplified pricing model across all its UK stores, reintroducing three clear price points, £1, £2 and £3, as part of its ongoing turnaround strategy.
Around 60% of
the discounter’s
grocery lines are now priced at £1,
reported
Retail Week, with categories including confectionery, health & beauty, and biscuits and cakes joining snacking, drinks, pet food and household, which shifted earlier in the year.
The retailer has begun test advertising in the West Midlands to highlight the new approach, which it said was designed to show shoppers “just how simple and straightforward getting amazing value should be”.
Related Story
Poundland cuts 100 head office jobs under restructure
24/09/2025 x 6:50 AM
Poundland will extend the three-price strategy to general merchandise and clothing in 2026, alongside the relaunch of its Pep&Co brand, led by returning design boss Maria Epaminondas and a refreshed buying team.
Managing director Barry Williams said: “We’ve reached a major milestone in converting the whole of our
grocery aisle
to a simple £1, £2 and £3 offer, reducing prices and focusing on the favourite items customers want us to bring them.
“But there’s much more to do, our Christmas and Halloween ranges, bought by our new in-house team, give a glimpse of what we’ll be bringing in 2026″.
Poundland revealed that it would be returning to pricing simplicity in August, taking the retailer back to its roots.
The business recently slashed 100 of its head office roles amid a restructuring of the company.
Positions were cut due to its withdrawal from online sales and the removal of its frozen and chilled food ranges in stores.
